org.sd.classifier
Interface FeatureAttribute

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseFeatureAttribute, IntegerFeatureAttribute, NominalFeatureAttribute, NumericFeatureAttribute, RealFeatureAttribute
public interface FeatureAttribute

Defines an attribute by name (schema level).

Author:
Spence Koehler, Dave Barney

getBagOfWords

java.lang.String[] getBagOfWords()
Convenience method to determine whether an attribute is a bag of words attribute based on its name pattern.

Returns:
the {bagName, bagWord} or null if it isn't a bag of words attribute.

toDouble

java.lang.Double toDouble(double value)
Convert the value to a double, if valid. Unless dictionary is locked, add the value to this attribute definition.

Returns:
the Double if the value is valid; otherwise, null.

getDefaultValue

java.lang.Double getDefaultValue()
Get a default value for this attribute if it is an attribute whose value is always present, even when not marked as such. If there is no default value then the "unknown" value (null here or a question mark in an arff) will be emitted.

A default value exists for features whose value is always known, but hasn't been explicitly set.

For example, bag of words features are either present or not. If not present, they haven't been seen, but it is known that they are not present as opposed to not knowing whether they are present.

Returns:
the default value or null if the attribute can be unknown.
